<th align="right" class="clear sponsor" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:13px;color:#252525;padding-right:8px;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:13px;color:#494949;padding-right:8px;" valign="middle">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;font-weight:bold;color:#000000;margin-top:15px;margin-bottom:15px;line-height:22px;">
TOGETHER WITH
</p>
</th>
<th class="clear" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400">
<a style="border-bottom:none!important;" target="_blank" href="https://info.attentivemobile.com/sms-101-webinar-morning-brew/?utm_source=morning-brew&utm_medium=cs-newsletter-1-20-22&utm_campaign=sms-101-webinar" class="">
<img alt="Attentive" style="width:100%;max-width: 155px; display: inline; vertical-align: middle;" width="155" src="https://media2.morningbrew.com/uploads/company/logo/71/1619618952-Attentive_Logotype_Black_RGB.jpg">
</a>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-top:20px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Good morning. </strong>You might know January 20 (today) as Inauguration Day, but that wasn’t always the case. Until the 20th Amendment was ratified in 1933, presidents were sworn in on March 4—four months after Election Day. Why such a big gap? Well, hundreds of years ago it took a long time to determine the election winner and distribute that news across the country.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">As communication and transportation technology improved, it dawned on lawmakers that maybe four months was <em>too </em>long to wait for a new president, because it led to extended “lame duck” periods where nothing got done in DC. So, they moved up Inauguration Day to one of the most bitterly cold times on the calendar.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">—<em>Neal Freyman, Jamie Wilde, Matty Merritt</em></p>
</div>
</td>
</tr>

</th>
</tr>
</table>

<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
GOVERNMENT
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2022/01/19/reviewing-biden-s-wins-and-setbacks-1-year-into-his-presidency?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}">
<font color="#000000">
Biden's presidency hits the 1-year mark
</font>
</a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2022/01/19/reviewing-biden-s-wins-and-setbacks-1-year-into-his-presidency?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}" class="">
<img alt="Biden and Kamala Harris popping out of the White House to celebrate their 1-year anniversary " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/facf740b8b47b64a9e5a0df51e5ff2cc38615961-1500x1005.jpg?w=670&q=70&auto=format">
</a><span class="source" style="display:inline-block;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px"><small><em>Photo Illustration: Dianna "Mick" McDougall; Sources: Getty Images</em></small></span>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Today marks one year since Bernie’s mittens took over our social media feeds and, perhaps more importantly, Joseph Robinette Biden Jr. was sworn in as the 46th president of the US.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">How’s he doing? Let’s take a quick spin.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Economy: </strong>Biden’s overseen a <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2022/01/07/mixed-december-jobs-report-highlights-the-us-worker-shortage?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">historic recovery</a> in the labor market, where the unemployment rate has plunged to 3.9% from a pandemic high of 14.8%. Problem is, there is currently too much money chasing too few goods. Inflation hit its highest rate since 1982 in December, while wages haven’t kept up with price growth.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px"><li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Median earnings for full-time workers grew 2.6% annually in the fourth quarter. Consumer prices, on the other hand, gained 7% in December.</span></li></ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Climate: </strong>Biden had the US rejoin the Paris climate agreement to reassert American leadership on environmental issues. But reaching his goal of cutting emissions in half by 2030 will be a monumental challenge: Emissions <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/climate-US-emissions-climbed?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">climbed 6.2%</a> last year as coal plants revved back to life.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Covid: </strong>The pandemic continued to rage throughout Biden’s first year in office. Despite the availability of vaccines, more people died of Covid in the US in 2021 than in 2020.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px"><li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Getting Americans vaccinated has proven to be a major challenge. Biden’s vaccine mandate on large employers was blocked by the Supreme Court, and only 63.8% of Americans are fully vaxed, putting it behind virtually all of its wealthy peers.</span></li></ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Geopolitics: </strong>Biden withdrew all US troops from Afghanistan in chaotic fashion and has maintained an adversarial relationship with China and Russia. He said yesterday that he expects Russia to invade Ukraine. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Domestic agenda: </strong>Biden signed a $1.9 trillion pandemic relief bill last spring and a $1.2 trillion bipartisan infrastructure bill, which represents the biggest federal investment in the nation’s roads, trains, and other important nuts-and-bolts networks in more than a decade. He also extended a moratorium on student loan payments through May 1.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Other priorities have run out of steam on Capitol Hill, where the Democrats have the slimmest of majorities in the Senate. The Build Back Better Act, which would have poured huge sums into environmental, health, and social programs, didn't get enough support.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Biden told reporters yesterday that he thinks Democrats can get “pieces, big chunks of the Build Back Better law signed into law.”</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead…</strong>Biden’s approval rating is in the dumps at 40% (Obama’s was 49% at the same point in his presidency). Democrats are hopeful that by taming inflation and the pandemic, Biden will get a popularity boost ahead of pivotal midterm elections in November.—<em>NF</em></p>
</div>

<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
ENERGY
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/texas-power-grid-freeze?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}">
<font color="#000000">
Texas's power grid right now
</font>
</a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/texas-power-grid-freeze?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}" class="">
<!--[if mso]>
<img alt="Scene from A Christmas Story where child is wrapped in a scarf." style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=377 src="https://images.morningbrew.com/gif/2022-01-19/image-1a65c946a4b2219eb489e8d66e9d1b16b6b0d955-480x270-gif/texas.gif">
<![endif]-->
<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt="Scene from A Christmas Story where child is wrapped in a scarf." style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://images.morningbrew.com/gif/2022-01-19/image-1a65c946a4b2219eb489e8d66e9d1b16b6b0d955-480x270-gif/texas.gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
</a><span class="source" style="display:inline-block;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px"><small><em><em>Warner Bros.</em></em></small></span>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The Texas power grid is about to get its biggest test since last February’s deep freeze.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">*Meteorologist voice*: After a cold front moved into the Lone Star State earlier this week, temps are set to drop below freezing today and tomorrow.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The Electric Reliability Council of Texas (ERCOT), Texas’s power grid operator, <a href="https://www.kxan.com/news/texas/ercot-says-cold-front-this-week-shouldnt-be-any-problem-for-texas-grid/?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">says</a> the grid is ready to roll. On Tuesday, it released a report after inspecting 321 power facilities that account for 85% of the grid’s power. The number of facilities with potential problems dropped from 16 in December to three.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">No one wants a repeat of last year, </strong>when disastrous blackouts caused millions of Texans to lose electricity, killed an estimated 700 people, and cost the state’s economy between $80 billion and $130 billion.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Politicians hot potatoed blame for the disaster, but eventually passed a bill that would require plants to winterize their operations or face a fine of $1 million per day.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">But there’s still a lot of work to do. Key energy infrastructure like pipelines and gas processing plants won’t be fully weatherized until later this year (a <a href="https://www.texasmonthly.com/news-politics/texas-electric-grid-failure-warm-up/?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">legislative loophole</a> allowed them to take their sweet time). And just this month, more than 10% of gas production in Texas was stopped for two days due to freezing temps.<em>—MM</em></p>
</div>

<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
SOCIAL MEDIA
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/instagram-tests-subscriptions?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}">
<font color="#000000">
So they won’t add you to their ‘Close Friends’…
</font>
</a>
</h1>
</td>

<a style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/instagram-tests-subscriptions?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}" class="">
<img alt="Instagram app screenshots" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/fc85addfac16cf29019c620f7e26326fe7615834-1024x768.jpg?w=670&q=70&auto=format">
</a><span class="source" style="display:inline-block;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px"><small><em>Instagram</em></small></span>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Soon, you’ll still be able to get exclusive content from your favorite influencers on Instagram—if you’re willing to pay for a monthly subscription.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Instagram announced a “Subscriptions” feature yesterday that will <a href="https://twitter.com/mosseri/status/1483867380878958593?t=LD8asBxh-7ekg4jpKId-3g&s=09" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">grant users access</a> to exclusive Stories and Lives, plus add a purple badge next to their name that’s visible to creators. Hey, it might improve your chance at a DM slide.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Some other details:</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>The feature is part of a </span><span><a href="https://techcrunch.com/2022/01/19/instagram-launches-early-test-of-creator-subscriptions-in-the-u-s/?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">limited test</a></span><span> that’s rolling out to just 10 creator accounts, including astrologist @</span><span><a href="https://www.instagram.com/alizakelly/?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">alizakelly</a></span><span> and Olympic gymnast @</span><span><a href="https://www.instagram.com/jordanchiles/?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">jordanchiles</a></span><span>.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Creators can charge $0.99 to $99 per month for their Subscriptions; Instagram CEO Adam Mosseri hailed recurring payments as “one of the best ways to have a predictable income” that’s not dependent on people hearting individual posts.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Meta has pledged to not take any share of the new revenue stream until at least next year.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">What’s the business strategy? </strong>Subscriptions could incentivize creators to make more content on Instagram—in turn luring their fans to spend more time on the social platform that ranks as teens’ <a href="https://finance.yahoo.com/news/snapchat-widens-lead-over-tik-tok-instagram-as-teens-favorite-social-media-app-piper-sandler-145605293.html?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">chuegy third-favorite</a> behind Snapchat and TikTok.<em>—JW</em></p>
</div>

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">And when it comes to SMS marketing strategy, Attentive is your go-to resource—their insights have helped brands bring in <em>billions</em> in revenue.</p>

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">And because real-life examples always drive home a good point, you’ll also get to see top brands that have built successful SMS marketing campaigns with Attentive.</p>

<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2022/01/19/key-performance-indicators-january-20?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}">
<font color="#000000">
Key performance indicators
</font>
</a>
</h1>
</td>

<a style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2022/01/19/key-performance-indicators-january-20?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}" class="">
<img alt='Bruno in "Encanto" ' style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/a3bba4eaf4b52edd0f80b67d6db516f48be80af9-1500x1000.jpg?w=670&q=70&auto=format">
</a><span class="source" style="display:inline-block;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px"><small><em>Disney </em></small></span>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Stat: </strong>“<a href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=bvWRMAU6V-c" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">We Don’t Talk About Bruno</a>,” a song written by Lin-Manuel Miranda for the film <em>Encanto</em>, is a <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/how-encantos-we-dont-talk-about-bruno-became-bigger-than-let-it-go-11642608106?mod=hp_featst_pos5" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">bigger hit</a> than even “Let It Go.” It rose to No. 4 on Billboard’s Hot 100 chart (“Let It Go” peaked at No. 5), and also became the highest-charting song from a Disney animated movie since “Colors of the Wind” in <em>Pocahontas</em>—26 years ago.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Quote: </strong>“This is one of the most delinquent, utterly irresponsible issues…I’ve seen in my aviation career.”</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Emirates President Tim Clark <a href="https://www.cnn.com/2022/01/19/business/emirates-5g-quest/index.html?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">blasted</a> the US’ handling of the C-band 5G rollout near airports, telling CNN his company wasn’t aware of the potential safety issues until a day before the launch. Global airlines have canceled flights to the US or had to switch aircrafts as Verizon and AT&T switched on 5G service.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Read: </strong>How a Brooklyn funeral home is trying to put a modern spin on death. (<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/marketing/stories/2022/01/19/how-a-brooklyn-funeral-home-is-trying-to-put-a-modern-spin-on-death?utm_campaign=mkb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Marketing Brew</a>)</p>
</div>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
EDUCATION
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/substitute-teacher-shortage-covid-omicron?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}">
<font color="#000000">
More classrooms are watching movies this year
</font>
</a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Schools around the country are facing a sub shortage so severe they can’t even stomach a Jimmy John’s joke right now. Oklahoma Governor Kevin Stitt <a href="https://www.npr.org/2022/01/19/1074109355/oklahoma-substitute-teachers-shortage-state-employees?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">signed</a> an executive order Tuesday to allow state employees to work as substitute teachers while keeping their current jobs, and yesterday New Mexico Governor Michelle Lujan Grisham even <a href="https://www.axios.com/new-mexico-national-guard-substitute-teacher-shortages-a1b529cd-72d5-4613-8068-924691eb43c1.html?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">asked</a> the National Guard to help grade all those personal essays.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Given the detrimental effects of Zoom school, officials are desperate to keep classrooms open. Problem is, Covid outbreaks are leading to dramatic staff shortages and draining substitute teacher reserves. So how are they coping?</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>States including California have rewritten the requirements to become a substitute teacher in order to speed up the hiring process and make it easier for retired teachers to come back.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Kansas lifted requirements for substitute teachers to the extent that individuals with no college experience can step in.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>In some Utah districts, principals are asking parents to be subs. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Big picture:</strong> At least 7,030 schools (about 7%) across the country canceled in-person classes last week because of Covid issues, like outbreaks or staffing shortages, according to the school tracking site Burbio.<em>—MM</em></p>
</div>

<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
GAMES
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;" href="#">
<font color="#000000">
The puzzle section
</font>
</a>
</h1>
</td>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Brew Mini: </strong>Huge shoutout to our puzzle wizard Mary Tobler, who has now written 100 crosswords for Morning Brew. Go, Mary! <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2022/01/19/brew-mini-hundred?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Try her 100th puzzle today</a>.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0"><strong style="color:#000">Three headlines and a lie</strong></h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Three of these news headlines are real and one is faker than that pop-punk “<a href="https://twitter.com/WWWYFest/status/1483499818357964802?s=20" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">When We Were Young</a>” festival. Can you guess the odd one out?</p>
<ol>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Heidi Klum says one of her legs </span><span><a href="https://www.nbcsandiego.com/entertainment/entertainment-news/heidi-klum-says-one-of-her-legs-cost-more-to-insure-than-the-other/2840601/?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">costs more</a></span><span> to insure than the other</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>A California city is overrun by crows. Could a </span><span><a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2022/01/17/us/sunnyvale-california-crows-lasers.html?utm_source=01182022&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=10384" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">laser</a></span><span> be the answer?</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Bono </span><span><a href="https://www.vulture.com/2022/01/bono-embarrassed-by-u2.html?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">reviews</a></span><span> U2: ‘I’m just so embarrassed’</span>

style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eGood morning. \u003c/strong\u003eYou might know January 20 (today) as Inauguration Day, but that wasn’t always the case. Until the 20th Amendment was ratified in 1933, presidents were sworn in on March 4—four months after Election Day. Why such a big gap? Well, hundreds of years ago it took a long time to determine the election winner and distribute that news across the country.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAs communication and transportation technology improved, it dawned on lawmakers that maybe four months was \u003cem\u003etoo \u003c/em\u003elong to wait for a new president, because it led to extended “lame duck” periods where nothing got done in DC. So, they moved up Inauguration Day to one of the most bitterly cold times on the calendar.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e—\u003cem\u003eNeal Freyman, Jamie Wilde, Matty Merritt\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003c/th\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003c!--[if !mso ]\u003e\u003c! -- --\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c!-- \u003c![endif]--\u003e\n\u003c!-- END HEADER --\u003e\n\u003c!-- MARKETS --\u003e\n\u003c!--[if !mso ]\u003e\u003c! -- --\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"c7\"\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"c6\" style=\"margin-bottom:7px\"\u003e\n\u003c!-- \u003c![endif]--\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse:collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003cth class=\"card\" style=\"text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px\"\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse:collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd class=\"pcard pcard370\" style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003ch3 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0\"\u003e\nMARKETS\n\u003c/h3\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse:collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd class=\"pad5m\"\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c!-- Nasdaq --\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd class=\"pads10 pads6m lastline\" style=\"border-bottom:1px solid #e6e6e6;padding-bottom:0;text-align: center; style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eHow’s he doing? Let’s take a quick spin.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eEconomy: \u003c/strong\u003eBiden’s overseen a \u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2022/01/07/mixed-december-jobs-report-highlights-the-us-worker-shortage?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\u0026mid={{md5(profile.email)}}\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ehistoric recovery\u003c/a\u003e in the labor market, where the unemployment rate has plunged to 3.9% from a pandemic high of 14.8%. Problem is, there is currently too much money chasing too few goods. Inflation hit its highest rate since 1982 in December, while wages haven’t kept up with price growth.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eMedian earnings for full-time workers grew 2.6% annually in the fourth quarter. Consumer prices, on the other hand, gained 7% in December.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eClimate: \u003c/strong\u003eBiden had the US rejoin the Paris climate agreement to reassert American leadership on environmental issues. But reaching his goal of cutting emissions in half by 2030 will be a monumental challenge: Emissions \u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/climate-US-emissions-climbed?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\u0026mid={{md5(profile.email)}}\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eclimbed 6.2%\u003c/a\u003e last year as coal plants revved back to life.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eCovid: \u003c/strong\u003eThe pandemic continued to rage throughout Biden’s first year in office. Despite the availability of vaccines, more people died of Covid in the US in 2021 than in 2020.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eGetting Americans vaccinated has proven to be a major challenge. Biden’s vaccine mandate on large employers was blocked by the Supreme Court, and only 63.8% of Americans are fully vaxed, putting it behind virtually all of its wealthy peers.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eGeopolitics: \u003c/strong\u003eBiden withdrew all US troops from Afghanistan in chaotic fashion and has maintained an adversarial relationship with China and Russia. He said yesterday that he expects Russia to invade Ukraine. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eDomestic agenda: \u003c/strong\u003eBiden signed a $1.9 trillion pandemic relief bill last spring and a $1.2 trillion bipartisan infrastructure bill, which represents the biggest federal investment in the nation’s roads, trains, and other important nuts-and-bolts networks in more than a decade. He also extended a moratorium on student loan payments through May 1.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eOther priorities have run out of steam on Capitol Hill, where the Democrats have the slimmest of majorities in the Senate. The Build Back Better Act, which would have poured huge sums into environmental, health, and social programs, didn't get enough support.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eBiden told reporters yesterday that he thinks Democrats can get “pieces, big chunks of the Build Back Better law signed into law.”\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking ahead…\u003c/strong\u003eBiden’s approval rating is in the dumps at 40% (Obama’s was 49% at the same point in his presidency). Democrats are hopeful that by taming inflation and the pandemic, Biden will get a popularity boost ahead of pivotal midterm elections in November.—\u003cem\u003eNF\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cdiv\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe Texas power grid is about to get its biggest test since last February’s deep freeze.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e*Meteorologist voice*: After a cold front moved into the Lone Star State earlier this week, temps are set to drop below freezing today and tomorrow.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe Electric Reliability Council of Texas (ERCOT), Texas’s power grid operator, \u003ca href=\"https://www.kxan.com/news/texas/ercot-says-cold-front-this-week-shouldnt-be-any-problem-for-texas-grid/?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esays\u003c/a\u003e the grid is ready to roll. On Tuesday, it released a report after inspecting 321 power facilities that account for 85% of the grid’s power. The number of facilities with potential problems dropped from 16 in December to three.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eNo one wants a repeat of last year, \u003c/strong\u003ewhen disastrous blackouts caused millions of Texans to lose electricity, killed an estimated 700 people, and cost the state’s economy between $80 billion and $130 billion.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003ePoliticians hot potatoed blame for the disaster, but eventually passed a bill that would require plants to winterize their operations or face a fine of $1 million per day.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBut there’s still a lot of work to do. Key energy infrastructure like pipelines and gas processing plants won’t be fully weatherized until later this year (a \u003ca href=\"https://www.texasmonthly.com/news-politics/texas-electric-grid-failure-warm-up/?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003elegislative loophole\u003c/a\u003e allowed them to take their sweet time). And just this month, more than 10% of gas production in Texas was stopped for two days due to freezing temps.\u003cem\u003e—MM\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS
